intro: Draba juvenalis, commonly known as the dwarf whitlow grass, is a small, flowering plant native to alpine and arctic regions. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, with basal leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates. Draba juvenalis is often found in mountainous areas and is an important component of alpine vegetation.
